general_advisory: Rainfall is expected during the next five days. Spray only when the sky becomes clear and use a sticker in the spray solution. Properly store rainwater for irrigation. Take plant protection measures due to high humidity. Ensure proper drainage in non-paddy crop fields.

advisory: Keep the rice plots weed free.
Apply low quantity of Nitrogen fertilizer to reduce the blast disease.
Spray chlorantraniliprole @ 6 ml /15 liter of water to control the stem borer.
Spray Imidachloprid @ 0.6 ml / liter of water to control the BPH.
Complete the transplanting. Use 4 - 5 seedlings / hill in age-old seedlings with closed spacing.
Develop a better drainage system to avoid waterlogging conditions.
Control root and stalk rot by spraying Validamycin 3% L @ 2 ml/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water.
Control fall armyworm by spraying Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/litre of water.

Prepare the field and raise Kharif groundnut of high-yielding varieties. Treat the seeds with Trichoderma viridae (10 gm.), Pseudomonas fluorescence (10 gm.) and Rhizobium culture (20 gm.) per kg of seed before sowing.
Spray Zineb 75% WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Tricyclazole 75% WP @ 1 g/litre of water when the sky becomes clear.
Transplant 25-35 days old seedlings in the main field.
Make necessary drainage channels to prevent waterlogging conditions.
Identify and fill gaps in the main field to maintain plant population.
Manage wilting in brinjal by spraying Tabuconazole @ 1 g/lt.
Be cautious of downy mildew attack in cucumber. If observed, spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% @ 2 g/litre of water on sunny days.
Ensure weeding and apply 54 kg urea per acre at 45 days after planting and apply mulching @ 2 t/acre.
Manage soft rot disease of ginger by applying Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets or Neem oil @ 75ml per 15ltr barrel tank sprayer.
Address bacterial wilt by drenching all beds with Bordeaux mixture 1% or copper oxychloride 0.2%.
Control Leaf gall and thrips by spraying Monocrotophos 36 WSC 1.5 ml/lit or Dimethoate 30 EC @ 2 ml/lit or Chlorpyriphos 2 ml/lit or neem oil 3% (30ml/lit) three rounds at monthly intervals.
Treat coffee for Stem borer management.
Manage Rhizome rot disease of turmeric by applying Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets or Neem oil @ 75ml per 15ltr barrel tank sprayer.
Maintain/creating optimum shade.
Thoroughly trace and uproot borer infested plants.
Install pheromone traps @ 25 /ha if the incidence is high.
Pad with chlorpyriphos 25% EC @ 5 ml by making a window in the stem at 5 cm x 5 cm and fill it with absorbent cotton dipped in insecticide solution and close it.
Keep dry fodder and straw ready for sheep and goats in the rainy season.
Flush to give balanced concentrate to sheep and goats one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Ensure filling of holes and crevices in the poultry house to prevent the entry of snakes and reptiles.
